lines.text: With all due respect, Colonel Daniels, if you do not follow us to Travis Air Force Base, I will blow you out of the sky.
General, with all due respect, fuck you, sir.

it explodes, sucks in all available oxygen to the core, vaporizes everything within a mile of ground zero, men, women, children, and one airborne virus. Destruction complete, case closed, crisis over.
[Takes a copy of the Constitution from his pocket]

unanimous, unwavering support for the president on this. And I mean, public. You're going to stand there shoulder to shoulder with him. He goes down, you go down. And the second thing is, I want an army of experts citing hundreds and thousands of lab experiments telling any idiot with a camera that there was no other way! Got that? Hmm? No member of this government is going to go sneaking off to the Washington Post, telling them how they were the "sole voice of opposition". If there is a voice of opposition out there, I want him in here, now!
[Throws photos of virus victims on the table]

Those are the citizens of Cedar Creek. Go on, look at them. These are not statistics, ladies and gentlemen. They're flesh and blood! And I want you to burn those into your memories. Because those images should haunt us until the day we die.
How many brain cells did I kill?
How many? About a billion.
Oh, now I'm only as smart as you.
What can we give him to kill his sense of humor?
I hate this bug.
Oh, come on, Casey. You have to admire its simplicity. It's one billionth our size and it's beating us.
So, what do you want to do, take it to dinner?
No.
What, then?
Kill it.
I have a friend in the Coast Guard, all I have to do is call...
How close a friend?
Closer than his wife would like.
If you think I'm lying, drop the bomb. If you think I'm crazy, drop the bomb. But don't drop the bomb just because you're following orders!
Sir, what did I ever do to make your life miserable?
You got up this morning, didn't you?
Sir, my pilot is taking a leak.
A leak? No shit!
You know Salt, fear gets a bad rap. I don't want anybody in my outfit that doesn't get scared.
Then I'm your man sir.
[George isn't cooperating with Daniels]
George, you've heard about this virus?... Shall I cough on you, George?
We are fugitives of the law. Idiocy is our only option.
Why don't you just for once take a chance?
You know what, Sam, I did, I married you.

[after his ex-wife's just hung up on him]
First we're fighting over the dogs now a virus. I can't believe this!
This could mean my stripes, sir.
It'll mean your ass if you don't get your finger on the phone. Finger it!
If one of them have it then ten of them will have it and if one of them leave Cedar Creek then we're in deep fucking shit... we're already in deep fucking shit!
You silly, sentimental son of a bitch. Nobody puts me under arrest. Nobody.

[last lines as Col. Briggs bars his path with a sidearm]
Colonel Briggs. What a wonderful moment this must be for you!
[Briggs grins as he leads him away]
Just don't get negative on me.
Affirmative.
Anything I can do to help?
Just don't make me nervous.

[to Daniels]
Allow me, sir.
[to Salt]
Major!
Yes... Major?
I hate them willies, they ought to call them the Sams don't you think?
Thank you, Mrs. - what was her name again?
Pananides!
You want a hotshot scope-jockey, fine, but, frankly, I'm hurt.
Go without a mask you'll see better!
